title: Understanding the 'Create from Selection' Feature
text: The 'Create from Selection' feature in Excel allows you to name ranges based on the labels in the rows or columns. This can be useful for quickly referencing data.

title: Steps to Create Names from Selection
text: To create names from a selection, you need to first select the cells that contain the data and the labels you want to use as names.

hintAnswer: select the cells, then click "create from selection"
title: Using the 'Create from Selection' Option
text: After selecting the cells, navigate to the 'Formulas' tab and click on 'Create from Selection'. This will allow you to use the labels in the selected cells as names.
choices: select the cells, then click "create from selection"
select the cells and enter values
click "create from selection" then select the cells
